intro: Notopleura perpapillifera, commonly known as the papillate notopleura, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and distinctive papillate (bumpy) structures on its leaves. Its leaves are typically ovate or elliptic in shape and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Notopleura perpapillifera is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
